intro: Stylidium semaphorum, commonly known as the signal plant, is a small flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Haemodoraceae and is characterized by its distinctive red, tubular flowers that resemble tiny signal lights. The plant has a basal rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and produces numerous small, showy flowers that bloom in spring. It thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and heathlands. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is a subject of interest in botanical studies and conservation efforts.
